idea-plugin.name: CallGraph
idea-plugin.description:
CallGraph visualizes caller–callee relationships for any Java method and lets you jump straight to definitions or call sites.

How to use

  1. Right-click on a method and select Generate Call Graph from the context menu
  2. Open CallGraph tool window (View → Tool Windows → CallGraph), place your caret on any Java method, and click the Generate button
  3. Use keyboard shortcut Alt+Shift+E (Option+Shift+E on macOS) while your caret is on a method
  4. Explore the graph: Click nodes to open methods, click edges to jump to exact calling lines
  5. Hide unwanted nodes: Click on a node and use the "Hide Node" button to clean up the visualization

Key features

  • Interactive call graph visualization with pan and zoom
  • Direct navigation to method definitions and call sites
  • Export diagrams as standalone HTML files
  • Open-source (GPL v3) – view the code on GitHub
